Summary Information Technology Leader and Manager focused on achieving business strategies and objectives. Experience at companies ranging in size from startup to $1 billion in annual revenue and across a wide variety of industries, including high technology hardware and software and healthcare. Collaborates effectively with senior leaders and staff across the organization to identify business needs and technology solutions and define and execute the tactical plans necessary to accomplish organizational goals, making efficient use of staff and financial resources. Particular strengths in: 
 
•	Strategic Planning	 
•	Program Management and Oversight 
•	Business/IT Partnership

•	M&A Due Diligence and Integration Experience VP of Information Systems & Real Estate Tripwire, Inc. 2010  –  2013  (3 years) Portland, Oregon Area As company’s first IT Executive, led 25-person geographically distributed team consisting of business systems/applications, network administration, corporate and R&D Lab systems administration, service desk, information security. Direct reports included Sr. Mgr. of Business Systems, Mgr. of Infrastructure & Operations, Sr. Security Engineer, Facilities Project Mgr. Added responsibility for Real Estate/Facilities in October 2011. Managed $9 million operating budget and $4 million companywide capital budget. 
 
•	Initiated dialogue with stakeholders at all levels of the company to understand needs, improve two-way communication and collaboration, and provide transparency into department priorities, projects, and operations. Actions contributed to 25% improvement in stakeholder satisfaction in one year.  
•	Worked with subordinate managers to design and implement governance structure enabling both tactical prioritization and strategic oversight and alignment between IS and business stakeholders in primary areas: CRM, Back Office Systems, BI, R&D Lab, Infrastructure & Operations. 
•	Developed approach, selected consulting partner, launched and led cross-functional team to identify and analyze core business process and system improvements needed to support company growth. Developed and executed three-year business systems roadmap while responding to changes in company ownership, executive leadership, and organizational structure. 
•	Developed risk assessment approach based on valuing avoidance of consequences to improve overall security posture. Worked with Sr. Security Engineer to define security project roadmap remediating highest priority risks. Delivered monthly updates to Risk & Security Oversight Board consisting of CFO, CTO, General Counsel, VP of R&D, and myself. 
­­	- Led System and Network Administration teams to achieve >75% compliance with Center for Internet Security (CIS) security configuration hardening standards for highest risk legacy IT infrastructure. VP of Information Systems & Finance Anesthesiologists Associated Inc. (AAI) 2005  –  2009  (4 years) Led geographically distributed information systems team consisting of business systems/applications, network and systems administration, service desk, information security. Added responsibility for three-person Finance and Accounting team in July 2008. Direct reports consisted of IT Director, Business Systems Manager, and Corporate Controller.  
 
•	Collaborated with CEO and CFO to successfully negotiate refund of $1 million software license fee based on lack of performance from Fortune 10 software supplier. 
•	Partnered with VP of Operations to lead office consolidation and offshoring projects following acquisition by former competitor that improved operational efficiency and reduced operating expenses by $2 million/year (18% of revenue). Completed offshoring of 45 operations positions two months ahead of schedule. AVP of Information Systems & Technology Qmedtrix Systems 2004  –  2005  (1 year) Led 25-person software/product development, quality assurance, tech writing, and project management team. Added responsibility for five-person information technology group: server, network, desktop support in 2005. Direct reports consisted of Software Development Manager, Software QA Manager, two Project Managers, Technical Writer, IT Manager.  
 
•	Worked with subordinate Managers of Systems Development and Software Quality Assurance to define and deploy operational metrics illuminating development project completion within 10% of estimated hours and test effectiveness > 95%. 
•	Partnered with VP of Product Development to select and deploy EDI infrastructure that supported 300% increase in transaction volume over 12 months and >75% of company revenue. 
•	Convinced executive team of value of adopting Situational Leadership program for company managers and senior staff members. Partnered with VP of Organizational Development to achieve instructor certification (Center for Leadership Studies) and deliver training to managers and senior individual contributors. VP of Client Systems LiveBridge 2002  –  2004  (2 years) Led 20-person software development, QA, and database administration team. Direct reports consisted of Development Manager, QA Manager, two Sr. Database Administrators.  
 
•	Worked with subordinate managers to design and, after earning support from CEO, successfully migrated from traditional organizational model consisting of development and support teams to new workgroup based structure to better align development teams with key clients, improve customer service, and enhance staff morale and professional development. Migration completed over 60-day period with no impact to existing customer commitments.  
­	Defined and deployed department metrics illuminating 40% reduction in error rate and 98% adherence to client schedules. 
­	Exceeded department revenue goals for client billable work by 20%. VP/CIO etrieve, Inc. 2001  –  2002  (1 year) Led all aspects of internal and external information technology for wireless infrastructure/ASP company. Developed and maintained product cost models. Direct reports included Director of Operations, Sr. Systems/Network Administrator, Reporting Analyst. 
 
•	Partnered with VP of Marketing and Directors of Worldwide Sales and Customer Service to successfully implement customer relationship management (CRM) solution for customer support, marketing, inside sales, and field sales groups. Project completed on schedule and on budget.  
•	Coordinated with VP of Engineering to consolidate three hosting locations into one, resulting in 60% reduction in monthly expense. Project executed with < 24 hours service outage and disruption to customers. 
•	Consulted with CEO to define service availability target and subsequently led IT team to achieve external infrastructure availability to over 99.95% through improved process control and targeted investment. Director of Worldwide Information Systems RadiSys Corporation 1996  –  2001  (5 years) Led geographically distributed international organization responsible for application design, deployment, and support, and worldwide computer and network operations. Direct reports included two Infrastructure & Operations Managers, Business Systems Manager, SAP Program Director, SAP Implementation Project Manager, and Systems Training Manager. 
 
•	Engaged all members of executive team to develop and maintain first 3-year department strategic plan. Established Executive IS Steering Committee to improve linkage between business goals and IT investments.  
•	Oversaw successful deployments of HRIS (Oracle HR), PDM (Agile Software) and ERP (SAP). Completed worldwide migrations from Microsoft Exchange to Lotus Notes.  
•	Partnered with Directors of Purchasing and Production Planning to extend e-commerce to customers and suppliers representing >50% of purchasing ($) volume. Reduced inventory by $9 million. Solutions included combination of EDI and other forms of electronic communication. 
•	Integrated IT infrastructures of four geographically remote acquisitions, ranging in size from 25 to 250 employees.  
•	Received President’s Award for Excellence in Leadership for leadership of companywide internal cross-functional Y2K readiness activities. Nominated by COO. Senior Information Systems Manager Integrated Measurement Systems 1995  –  1996  (1 year) Managed organization responsible for worldwide information technology infrastructure for a semiconductor test equipment manufacturer. Senior Information Systems Manager Sequent Computer Systems 1988  –  1995  (7 years) Managed groups providing business system architecture, business process improvement, and application analysis and support for Enterprise Division and Worldwide Customer Services, Manufacturing, Finance, and Engineering organizations. Project Manager Intel Corporation 1983  –  1988  (5 years) Managed implementation of mainframe-based manufacturing/materials system at both domestic and international manufacturing sites. Production Supervisor Intel Corporation 1979  –  1981  (2 years) Managed 17-person team in semiconductor test operation. Summary Seasoned technical manager with the ability to lead multi-disciplinary integrated teams, ensuring effective application of sound engineering practices for robust equipment and process maintenance and improvement. Leadership and technical skills honed with twenty-one years of experience at a world-class semiconductor manufacturer.   Key attributes: 
•	Actively coaches, trains, and mentors both engineers and technicians in skill development. 
•	Has managed engineering staffs of up to twelve and technician staffs of up to twenty-five. 
•	Utilizes careful planning and strict attention to detail to ensure on-time completion of projects. 
•	Routinely participates in technology transfers, delivering successful process matching each time. 
•	Drives safety, environmental, defect, and cost improvement projects.  
•	Manages area capacity requirements and supervises equipment installation and qualification. 
•	Collaborates closely with commercial partners to mange vendor performance. 
•	Applies sound data extraction and statistical analysis techniques, such as statistical process control and design of experiments, to maintain and improve process and product quality.  
•	Applies lean principles and practices, particularly 5S and high precision maintenance techniques. Summary Ken Miller, author of "We don't make Widgets" compares government processes as a set of pipes that are kinkedup, contorted and a twisted mess. If that is the case, I am a plumber who can help eliminate blockages, straighten the pipes and increase the flow. I primarily use my knowledge of Lean and Six Sigma to facilitate workgroups to find solutions to their process problems, sometimes creating an entire new process. I use technology in it's simplest forms as tools and look at the space "between the work" to find ways to decrease throughput time and find gains in capacity. 
 
I've worked in both private industry and government. In 2009 transferred my knowledge of Lean to Government, as I have worked with the State of Oregon in the Water Rights Division, the Department of Administrative Services to assist in the creation of the Office of Transformation (assuming the role of Black Belt in leading Lean Six Sigma projects). I have also worked with the Department of Revenue, Dept. of Consumer and Business Services and the Oregon State Hospital. I have recently joined the Department of Fish and Wildlife as their Lean Coordinator in the Directors Office where I work on administrative processes and assist other state agencies through an Inter-Governmental Agreement. 
 
I belong to the Mt. Hood Ski Patrol utilizing customer service and rescue skills on a weekly basis. Awarded Associate Patroller of the Year and Coach of the Year for 2009 and Associate Supervisor of the year for 2013. For the past 18 years I have donated time to the Boy Scouts of America as a volunteer leader and received the Silver Beaver Award in 2009. This is the highest National award presented to volunteers in the Council. Also named Scouter of the Year for 2009 in the Columbia Gorge District. 
 
Specialties: Lean Processes , Creation of High Performance teams, Six Sigma Certified. Expertise in Planning, Supply Chain Operations, Budget Development, New Product Introductions and Change Management. Manufacturing Manager Scantronic USA March 1985  –  May 1991  (6 years 3 months) Scantronic originated as Datura International, a small electronics company in Stockton California. During the 6 years I was there we grew tremendously as we were purchased and merged with other companies. It was a great opportunity to gain profitability and add employment in a disadvantaged area. During this time I: 
 
• Managed 100 production operators and 5 supervisors, growing from $4M/year to $20M/yr production over 5 year period. 
• Improved 1st pass yields from 70% to 95% utilizing a closed loop system.

• Chaired the San Joaquin Mayors Committee for Employment of Disabled Persons which conducted training opportunities for local employers to promote the hiring of disabled persons in private industry. 
• Received Governor’s Award for Employment of the Disabled in 1990 as Large Employer of the Year for California. 
• Established a partnership with the California Human Development Corporation to train newly arrived refugees from Southeast Asia in electronics at no cost to Scantronic. Provided material and technical support. 
 
We earned many awards during this time for our involvement in the community for helping to provide training and jobs to several disadvantaged ethnic groups and the disabled. It was a Win-Win situation that I am very proud of. 
 
I left to join Sharp Microelectronics, closer to my family in Portland.
